text: では吉澤さんの許可を取ればよろしいんですね / ええ
translation: So I just need to get Yoshizawa-san's permission, right? / Yes.

vocabulary.meaning: to take, to get, to obtain

grammar: では marks a conclusion; ～ばよろしい is a formal conditional pattern meaning 'if you do X, that's fine'

text: ウイツ氏の承諾は得ておりますから / はい / はいでは / たらい回しか / 今から命令書が届く / 作業は正式なものだ / そんな間に合わないわ
translation: Since I've already obtained Mr. Witz's consent... / Yes. / Yes, well then... / Are they giving us the runaround? / The orders will arrive soon. / The work is official. / There's no way that will make it in time!

vocabulary.meaning: to be in time, to make it

grammar: ～ております is a humble/formal form of ～ている; そんな as an adverb means 'such' or emphasizes impossibility

text: 爆発してからじゃ何もかも遅いのよ
translation: Once it explodes, it'll be too late for everything!
grammar: ～してからじゃ means 'after X happens, then...'; のよ is feminine sentence-ending particle for emphasis

text: ジェットアーロンは厚着方面に向かい進行中 / 時間がないわ / これより先は私の独断で行動します / あしからず / あ、ヒュウガくん / 厚着にナッシー付けといたから
translation: Jet Alone is heading toward Atsugi and advancing. / We don't have time. / From here on, I'll act on my own authority. / I hope you'll forgive me. / Ah, Hyuga-kun. / I've sent the transport to Atsugi, so...
grammar: ～に向かい is 'heading toward'; これより先は means 'from here on'; ～ておく indicates preparation or advance action

text: シンジ君と初号機をF装備でこっちに起こして / そう、緊急事態 / 無駄よ、おやみなさい、桂木一
translation: Send Shinji-kun and Unit-01 here with F-Type equipment. / Yes, it's an emergency. / It's useless. Stop this, Katsuragi.

vocabulary.meaning: to wake up, to mobilize, to send

grammar: ～てこっちに起こして is 'send it here'; おやみなさい is the formal command form of やめる

text: 第一、どうやって止めるつもりなの? / 人間の手で直接
translation: First of all, how do you plan to stop it? / Directly, by human hand.

vocabulary.meaning: first of all, in the first place

grammar: どうやって means 'how, by what means'; ～つもり expresses intention/plan

text: 本気ですか / ええ / しかしライブはすでに汚染物質が充満している / 危険すぎる
translation: Are you serious? / Yes. / But the reactor is already filled with contaminants. / It's too dangerous.

vocabulary.meaning: to be filled with, to be saturated

grammar: すでに means 'already'; ～すぎる means 'too ~, excessively ~'

text: うまくいけばみんな助かります
translation: If it goes well, everyone will be saved.

vocabulary.meaning: to be saved, to be rescued

grammar: ～ば conditional means 'if'; うまくいく is an idiomatic expression for success

text: ここの式信号が切れるとハッチが手動で開けますから / バックパックから内部に侵入できます
translation: When the control signal is cut here, the hatch can be opened manually. / So we can enter the interior from the backpack.
grammar: ～と conditional indicates automatic consequence; ～から explains reason

text: 希望
translation: Hope.
grammar: Single word statement - the password being given

text: プログラム消去のパスワードだ
translation: It's the password for deleting the program.
grammar: の marks possessive/relationship; だ is the plain copula

text: ありがとう
translation: Thank you.
grammar: Standard expression of gratitude

text: 目標はJA / 5分以内に炉心誘拐の危険があります
translation: The target is JA. / There's a danger of reactor meltdown within 5 minutes.
grammar: ～以内に means 'within (time/space)'; があります indicates existence of danger

text: ですから目標をこれ以上人口密集時に近づけるわけにはいきません / ヒューガ君 / はい
translation: Therefore, we cannot let the target get any closer to populated areas. / Hyuga-kun. / Yes.
grammar: わけにはいかない means 'cannot possibly do'; これ以上 means 'any more than this'

text: エヴァを切り離した後は速やかに離脱 / 安全高度まで上昇して / 了解 / シジ君 / はい / 目標と並走し私を背後部に取り付けて / 以後は目標の移動を可能な限りせき止めてね
translation: After detaching the Eva, withdraw promptly. / Ascend to a safe altitude. / Understood. / Shinji-kun. / Yes. / Run alongside the target and attach me to the rear. / After that, stop the target's movement as much as possible, okay?
grammar: ～した後は means 'after doing ~'; 可能な限り means 'as much as possible, to the extent possible'

text: なるんですか / ミサトさんが / そうよ / そんな無 / 茶な / 無茶は承知よ / 他にベターな方法がないの / でも、危なすぎますよ / 大丈夫
translation: You're going to do it? / Misato-san is? / That's right. / That's so reck... / less... / I know it's reckless. / There's no better method. / But it's too dangerous! / It'll be fine.
grammar: ～んですか is explanatory question form; ～は承知 means 'I'm aware of ~'; ～すぎる means 'too ~'

text: エヴァなら万が一の直撃にも耐えられるわ / じゃなくて、ミサトさんが
translation: The Eva can withstand even a direct hit in the worst case. / That's not what I mean - it's you, Misato-san!
grammar: ～なら conditional means 'if it's ~'; ～にも means 'even to ~'; じゃなくて negates and redirects

text: ま、やれることやっとかないとね / 後味悪いでしょ
translation: Well, I have to do what I can, right? / It would leave a bad taste otherwise.

vocabulary.meaning: to do in advance (casual form of やっておく)

grammar: ～ておく (contracted to ～とく) indicates doing something in preparation; ～ないとね means 'have to ~, right?'

text: 目標を肉眼で確認
translation: Visual confirmation of target.
grammar: Technical/military reporting language - noun phrases without verbs

text: さあ、行くわよ
translation: Alright, here we go!
grammar: さあ is an interjection for readiness; わよ is feminine emphatic particle

text: エヴァー10日1日 / ドッキングアウト / 了解
translation: Eva Unit-01. / Docking out. / Roger.
grammar: Military/technical communication style

text: あと4分もないわ!このまま乗りつけて!
translation: We don't even have 4 minutes left! Just ride right up to it!

vocabulary.meaning: to ride up to, to charge in

grammar: ～もない emphasizes lack ('not even ~'); このまま means 'just as is, without changing'

text: 構わ / ないろ!やって!
translation: Don't worry about it! Just do it!
grammar: 構わない means 'don't worry about it'; imperative form for urgency

text: 美里さん!
translation: Misato-san!
grammar: Vocative - calling out someone's name

text: 気をつけて!
translation: Be careful!

vocabulary.meaning: to be careful, to watch out

grammar: ～て form as imperative for requests/warnings

text: この敵は、あなた
translation: This enemy is... you.
grammar: は marks the topic; dramatic pause before revelation

text: エラー?何よこれ
translation: Error? What is this?
grammar: よ adds emphasis/emotion; これ refers to 'this (situation)'

text: 間違いないプログラムが書いてあるんだ
translation: There's definitely a program written here.
grammar: ～てある indicates a state resulting from someone's action; んだ is explanatory ending

text: 動力炉臨海点まであと0.2 / 制御棒作動しません / こうなったら一か八かね
translation: 0.2 until the reactor reaches critical point. / Control rods won't operate. / At this point, it's do or die.

vocabulary.meaning: sink or swim, do or die

grammar: まであと means 'remaining until'; こうなったら means 'at this point, things being as they are'
